        Overview
        At the High Density Electronic Systems Lab at IIIT-Bangalore, we
            focus on research and development in the area of Approximate computing design and libraries, Low power VLSI circuits,
            FPGA accelerator designs for AI/ML applications, and other emerging VLSI design techniques. 
        HiDES is affiliated to Center of Electronics and Embedded systems
        	lab (CEEMS) at IIITB. The HiDES lab at IIITB
	    	 is sponsored by Government of Karnataka. Projects
	    	 running in HiDES lab is sponsored by SERB, MEITY, MSJE,
             IBM Shared University Research, INTEL-FICE,
	    	 and Government of Karnataka.
          
          
          The following projects were completed by iMTech student groups as a part of lab courses conducted in HiDES lab in the mentioned
          semesters.
          
          Fall 2017 -- Analog Circuits and Systems Lab ,
          Spring-2019 -- Electronics devices and Circuits Lab ,
          Spring-2018 -- Electronics devices and Circuits Lab ,
          Spring-2017 -- Electronics devices and Circuits Lab ,
          Fall-2018 -- Basic Electronics Lab ,
		Fall-2017 -- Basic Electronics Lab ,
		  Fall-2016 -- Basic Electronics Lab ,
		  Spring-2015 -- Basic Electronics Lab,
		  Spring-2014 -- Basic Electronics Lab, and
		  Spring-2013 -- Basic Electronics Lab
		  
		  



		
		


				

				Currently Trending
				 Yashaswi M (IMT2016) and Viraj K Bharadwaj's work on "Novel Approximate Multiplier Designs for Edge Detection Application" got accepted in 31st ACM Great Lakes Symposium on VLSI, to be held from June 22-25, 2021 (Virtual Conference).	
				
				 Pranav Kedia's work on "GenGrid: A Generalised Distributed Experimental Environmental Grid for Swarm Robotics" got accepted in IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA), to be held from May 30 - June 5, 2021 (Virtual Conference).	
				
				
				
				
				
		

		Openings
		
		 See new openings for prospective students and Post-Doctoral Fellows in News/Events/Openings
